Field Detail

m_Subscriptions

protected java.util.ArrayList<PublishSubscribeManager.Subscription<tPublisher,tSubscriber>> m_Subscriptions
A list of all subscriptions currently active in the PublishSubscribeManager.

m_EmptyPublication

protected tPublication m_EmptyPublication
A publication object which is used for retrieving class information when retrieving a method through reflection.

m_CompareExact

protected boolean m_CompareExact
Boolean which determines what type of comparison should be used when comparing the subscriptions publisher with the publisher of a publication. If true the comparison will use memory addresses and if false will use the method Object.equlas()

Constructor Detail

PublishSubscribeManager

public PublishSubscribeManager(tPublication pEmptyPublication)
Construct a PublishSubscribeManager using exact comparisons. Publishers will be identified by their address.

Parameters:
pEmptyPublication - An object of the publication type that can be used to retrieve class information during reflection lookups.

PublishSubscribeManager

public PublishSubscribeManager(tPublication pEmptyPublication,
                               boolean pCompareExact)
Construct a PublishSubscribeManager using one of two different comparison methods.

Parameters:
pEmptyPublication - An object of the publication type that can be used to retrieve class information during reflection lookups.
pCompareExact - if true publishers will be compared based on address. If false publishers will be compared using the equals() method defined in all classes deriving from type Object.
Method Detail

Subscribe

public void Subscribe(tPublisher pPublisher,
                      tSubscriber pSubscriber,
                      java.lang.String pMethod)
               throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
Register a new object interested in publications from a publisher. This function requires the subscriber to have a function with the method signature void pMethod(tPublisher pPublisher, tPublication pPublication) It is possible (and potentially undesirable) to subscribe multiple times to the same publisher. Each subscription will result in an invocation of the specified subscription function.

Parameters:
pPublisher - The object whose publications should be recieved.
pSubscriber - The object which wishes to recieve publications.
pMethod - The name of the method in pSubscriber to be invoked.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the subscriber object does not contain a method named pMethod with the parameters (tPublisher, tPublication).

Publish

                    tPublication pPublication)
Notify All Interested Subscribers Of A New Publication.

Parameters:
pPublisher - The object which is publishing information
pPublication - The object containing publication information

Remove All Subscriptions Made By A Particular Subscriber

pSubscriber - The subscriber which should be removed from the subscription list.

ForceUnsubscribe

public void ForceUnsubscribe(tPublisher pPublisher)
Remove all subscriptions to a particular publisher

Parameters:
pPublisher - The publisher which wants to remove all subscriptions to it.
